document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Pediculaster (Acari: Pygmephoridae) from Western Siberia, Russia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Pediculaster (Acari: Pygmephoridae) from Western Siberia, Russia

heading.emphasis:
Key to phoretic females of the genus
Pediculaster
of Palaearctic

subSubSection.paragraph:
(
Pediculaster limosinae
Samsinak, 1984
is not separable from
P. sellnickianus
and is probably a junior synonym of
P. sellnickianus
;
Pediculaster incompletus
Samsinak, 1984
is not separable from
P. morelliae
and is probably a junior synonym of
P. morelliae
)

paragraph.keyLead: 3 . Dorsal hysterosomal setae relatively short: setae d distinctly shorter than distance d–d .............................. 4

- Dorsal hysterosomal setae very long: setae d distinctly longer than distance d–d ........
P. arcanus (
Rack, 1967
)
. Germany

4 . Setae e and h 2 subequal, setae
v 1
more than three times longer than
v 2 .
...........
P. subarcanus
Gao and Zou, 2000
. China

- Setae e about 3 times longer than h 2 , setae
v 1
less than 2 times longer than
v 2 .
.
P. ermilovi
sp. nov .
Russia (Western Siberia).
5 . Setae ( u ) of tibiotarsus I fused together forming structure opposing to tarsal claw.................................. 6

- Setae ( u ) of tibiotarsus I separated, spine-like.......

9 . Apodemes 5 long, reaching almost to bases of setae 4 b , setae e about 5 times longer than h 2 ..................................................................................................

)
. Palaearctic

- Apodemes 5 short, reaching bases of setae 4 a , setae e about 3 times longer than h 2 ......................................................................................

. Ukraine , Russia (Crimea).

. Germany

. Germany
